title: Great Place to Work and FORTUNE Name Miami Children's Health System One of the Best Workplaces for Women
description: The Best Workplaces for Women also set themselves apart from competitors in other important ways: 95 percent of women at these organizations describe them as friendly, and the same share say they're proud to tell others where they work.
cleaned_text: Published on: 09/15/2017 It takes the hard work of each and every employee at [Miami Children's [career](http://www.mchr.com), and we're proud to announce that Great Place to Work and FORTUNE have named MCHS one of the country's Best Workplaces essential for a great workplace. The Health System came in #55 on the list. Miami Children's Health System values employee health, wellness, professional development and work-life balance by offering programs that support personal and professional goals. The health system has a longstanding commitment to offering a large variety of education, mentoring and training options. The organization makes it a recognize and supported through an on-site child care center and preschool at the main hospital campus, dry cleaning services that pick up and deliver to various locations, car wash services, discounts on entertainment and much more. Research from Great Place to Work has shown that women are five times more likely to plan a long-term future with their employers when they say they're treated as full members of the team, regardless of position. The Best Workplaces for Women also set apart from competitors in important ways: 95 percent of women at these organizations describe them as friendly, and the same share say they're proud to tell others where they work. Best Workplaces for Women deserve recognition for crafting environments men and women bring their best selves to work each day," said Michael Bush, CEO of Great Place to Work. The Best Workplaces for Women is one of a [series of rankings by Great Place to Work](https://www.greatplacetowork.com/list-calendar) and FORTUNE based on employee feedback from Great Place to Work-Certified organizations. The Health System also was ranked as a Best Workplace in Healthcare and a Best Workplaces for Millennials, by Great Place to Work and FORTUNE. About Miami Children's Health System Founded in 1950 by Variety Clubs International, Nicklaus Children's Hospital, part of Miami Children's Health System, is South Florida's only licensed specialty hospital exclusively for children, with and 220 renowned has many programs ranked among the nation's best by U.S. News & World Report. The organization has grown and evolved into the Miami Children's Health System (MCHS) which includes Miami Children's Health Foundation, the organization's 10 nonprofit Miami-Dade, Broward and Specialists of America, a nonprofit physician practice subsidiary; a management services organization, and an ambulatory surgery center, as well as an e-commerce line of children's wellness and safety products that region's only healthcare system exclusively for children.
